channel.title: Hailing Frequency - Star Trek Gaming Podcast 'The Internets Only Podcast Dedicated to Star Trek Gaming'
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Internets First Podcast Dedicated to Star Trek Gaming!!
channel.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous and Tony Tuthill
channel.itunes:summary: The Internets First Podcast Dedicated to Star Trek Gaming!! Each week we bring you the latest news and happening in the Star Trek Gaming world! From Clan Wars to Massivly Multiplayer Trek Games, we cover it all in an exciting, entertaining and leading format!
channel.description: Started in 2005, Hailing Frequency is the ONLY podcast on the internet dedicated to Star Trek Gaming. Covering all aspects, from official games such as Star Trek Online to semi-official games such as Star Trek Excalibur, your hosts, Zach, Kinneas, Nova and our Vulcan-Like Newsgirl K'suan'indra present you all of the current events in this genre in an entertaining and leading format. We have one several awards over the years and to date have had over 10 million downloads!

item.title: Hailing Frequency #75 - STGN, Excalibur Interview, BC2, STO and more!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Ryan White
item.itunes:summary:
Episode 75 has arrived and its another fun filled, jam packed show.
K'suan'indra gets us up to date on all of the latest Star Trek Gaming News and then later in the show, Mark Ward joins us to talk about the latest developments in the upcoming fan game, Star Trek Excalibur.
Jigallypuff also joins us to talk about some mod plagurism issues that have been occuring in the Birth of the Federation community, plus Zach and Nova discuss all of the latest Star Trek Online happenings as well as the recent announcement of the fan game, Bridge Commander 2

item.title: Hailing Frequency #74 - STGN, Mod Weekly Returns, ST Freelance, Star Trek Online, more!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Ryan White
item.itunes:summary:
Hailing Frequency returns for its first episode since February 2010 and does not disappoint. In this one hour show, we talk about all of the latest Star Trek Online updates that have hit the game since its launch in February, including the Season 1 updates, the upcoming Season 2 updates and beyond.
Later on in the show, we sit down with Griffin Endurance, lead developer of the Freelance Mod for Star Trek Elite Force 1 - a very exciting upcoming mod that promises to add a forking storyline to the game, flight controls, and a full RPG system!
Most excitingly - this edition of Hailing Frequency sees the return of the highly popular and critically acclaimed segment - "Mod Weekly". Mod Weekly is a long-time Hailing Frequency segment that was with the podcast from its roots back in 2005, until late 2008 when the segment presenter, Croesus, retired to focus on his real life work.
Now, the segmenth as been revived by community member and modder - Max Loef. Max has produed mods for a range of Star Trek Games, including Legacy and Bridge Commander. He is also an experienced ship modeller, and is a perfect new host for Mod Weekly!.
Rounding out the show, K'suan'indra brings us the latest Star Trek Gaming News, and we have a fantastic edition of Fleet Radio!

item.title: Hailing Frequency Interview - Craig Zinkevich, Executive Producer Star Trek Online
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill, Ryan White
item.itunes:summary:
On the evening of Wednesday 27th Jan (2010) we sat down with Craig Zinkevich for a final audio interview before Star Trek Online releases next week on February 2nd!
We asked a tonne of community submitted questions on subjects ranging from the genesis system to social planets, along with some retrospective questions on the last 2 years of development and all in all, its a great interview with a cargo-bay full of information!

item.title: Hailing Frequency #72 - Christmas 2009 Special - STO Interview, Closed Beta Competition, Video, Screenshots and more!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous. Tony Tuthill, Ryan White
item.itunes:summary:
The Hailing Frequency 2009 Christmas Special is upon us and we have a truly awesome show for you!
During the show, we take a look back at what 2009 has brought to us and look forward to what 2010 has in store. Ksuan brings us all of the latest Star Trek Gaming News, and at approximatly 30 minutes into the show, our special guests join us
Craig Zinkevich, Christine Thompson, Dan Griffis and Joe Blancato from Cryptic Studios spend a whopping 40 minutes with us talking about Star Trek Online and answering our questions along with a tonne of community submitted questions.
Following on from that - perhaps the only thing in the world that could be better than an interview with those 4 - we launch the Hailing Frequency Star Trek Online Closed Beta Competition where you have a chance to win one of 150 closed beta keys we have to giveaway for Star Trek Online! Details for the competition are below.
After that, Mindwipe, a popular figure from the Star Trek Gaming Community gives us his thoughts about 2009 and his outlook for 2009 and ending the show, we have a 3 minute compilation of christmas greetings from the Star Trek Gaming Community

item.title: Hailing Frequency #70 - Tonnes of STO News, Zinkievich Interview and more!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous
item.itunes:summary:
We are very happy to announce that Episode Number 70 of Hailing Frequency is hereby released, recorded to a live audience on Sunday 6th September 2009.
This episode sets both a record and milestone for Hailing Frequency - it is our 100th Audio Production since 2005, meaning we have released a total of 70 full length podcasts and 30 shorter special episodes such as interviews, road reports, etc. This is also possibly the longest episode of Hailing Frequency which will ever occur, running a whopping two hours and ten minutes.
You might be asking yourself - what could they possibly have spent two hours and ten minutes talking about and the answered lies in the fact that we have just had the busiest period of Star Trek Online News - EVER!.
Cryptic Studios attended Penny Arcade Expo in Seattle this weekend, taking with them the first ever publicly playable demo of Star Trek Online and Hailing Frequency (with the help of Tamgros and Vmann from AoA) were there to cover it. We released almost thirty high def photos of Star Trek Online, an 8 minute gameplay video and a 20 minute video interview with Craig Zinkevich.
In addition, information about Star Trek Online was coming from dozens of other sources, so we discuss everything we have learnt over the past two weeks about Star Trek Online in this bumper show.
Other than Star Trek Online, K'suan'indra brings us all of the latest Star Trek Gaming News from across the franchise and we bring you Episode 2 of Fleet Focus where this week, we speak to Fleet Admiral Fyasko of The Risen Phoenix Fleet!

item.title: Hailing Frequency #69 - STGN, Fleet Focus, Khyrons Korner, STO News, more!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Ryan White
item.itunes:summary:
Episode 69 of Hailing Frequency is hereby released. Recorded to a live audience on Saturday 22nd August, this episode runs approximatly 1hr 26mins.
Kinneas and K'suan'indra are currently on a well deserved shore leave on Risa, so filling in for them this week, we have Jatal Khyron and Soulful Latina respectivly, who both do excellent jobs in their temporary positions!
The show starts as always with the Star Trek Gaming News and we then descend into a conversation about the latest Star Trek Online Video Trailer which was released at GamesCon in Germany. Later on in the show, we also talked about the hypercool UI screenshot that Craig Zinkievich released on his Twitter Account.
Launching in this show, we have two great new segments. The first, entitled "Fleet Focus" is a new regular segment where each week, we will sit down and interview a different Star Trek Gaming Clan so that members of our audience can get to know some of the wide selection of fleets out there.
The second is a new Star Trek Online Opinion Segment from Jatal Khyron entitled "Khyrons Korner". Jatal is embedded in the Star Trek Online Forums and each week he will tackle a different hot topic. This time around, its the subject of Microtransactions - Friend or Foe?!.

item.title: Hailing Frequency #68 - STGN, STO news, Interview with Craig Zinkievich and more!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
This is episode 68 of Hailing Frequency, our first "normal" episode since our stream of specials over the past few weeks as we covered the New Jersey and Las Vegas Star Trek Conventions. Episode 68 was recorded on Saturday August 8th and our interview with Star Trek Online's Executive Producer Craig Zinkievich was run during this show for the first time. I am sure you have all heard it already, but how can you ever get tired of it?
Ksuan brings us all of the latest Star Trek Gaming and Star Trek Online news as usual and we talk about some of the Star Trek Online screenshots that were released at Kotaku. Another great show and well worth the download as usual! Enjoy Folks!

item.title: Hailing Frequency Special - Road Report #2 from the New Jersey Trek Con!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Ryan White
item.itunes:summary:
This is the second and final special report from Hailing Frequency for August 1st 2009 covering the New Jersey Star Trek Convention which is being run by Creation Entertainment and that is tagged as the Largest Star Trek Convention on the East Coast.
On the floor, is our Hailing Frequency Technical Director and Co-Host, Ryan L White aka Nova, who has been hard at work all day capturing HD Video, taking Photos and conducting interview after interview with folks such as Barry Jenner (Admiral Ross of DS9).
In this second road report, Nova lets us know everything thats been happing in the last 5 hours and its sounds like an aweful lot of fun, so if you arnt lucky enough to be there, this is the next best thing.

item.title: Hailing Frequency #67 - STGN, State of Franchise, KM1.0, STO News and More!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill, Ryan White
item.itunes:summary:
This is our second show since our 8 week break for updates and reformatting and the changes continue in this show with a selection of new segment and backing music provided by our talented musician, Tim Reinink. K'suan'indra once again brings us the Star Trek Gaming News, in two parts and our special guest on this show is Victor1st from startrek-gamers.com who opens our discussion into the current state of the Star Trek Gaming Franchise, with a 10 minute recording of his thoughts and predictions for the next 12-24 months.
Later in the show, we discuss the latest Star Trek Online Updates including the new Klingon Ship which can only be described as a behemoth and following on from this, Napalm006 joins us once again to discuss mods - last week it was Fleet Operations 3, this week it is Kobayashi Maru 1.0 for Bridge Commander.

item.title: Hailing Frequency #66 - Excalibur Interview, News, UFP Media and More!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill, Ryan White
item.itunes:summary:
Old is mixed with new in this show, as the hosts, Zach, Kinneas and Nova discuss all of the latest happenings in the world of Star Trek Gaming. As usual, K'suan'indra brings us the Star Trek Gaming News, though in a new two-part format which focus on Modding/Fan Games and Star Trek Online, respectivly.
During the show, we interview Mark Ward, Lead Artist of ST: Excalibur and we find out some amazing information about what future updates they have planned, plus their newtonian physics system and what this means for ship control and playability.
Kinneas bring us the first new segment pilot, for something we call UFP Media which envisions how an "in-character" radio station might work in Star Trek Online and during the show, we premiere several new adverts from various Star Trek Guilds including Zeta Fleet who will soon be celebrating their 1 year anniversary.
We also disscus how the closure of StarTrek-Games.com is affecting the community and the most recent screenshots to come out of Cryptic Studios for Star Trek Online.
New Voice Talent in this show is provided by Napalm006 and new music sections in this show are produced by our talented new composer, Tim Reinink.

item.title: Hailing Frequency #59 - Cryptic Interview, STGN, STO News and More!!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
In this episode, we feature an EXCLUSIVE Interview with Cryptic Studio's Head of Community Relations, Nicole Hamlett. (This was released as a separate file a few days ago.)
In the interview we discuss the how the community of STO will be handled inside and outside of the game post launch, upcoming website features, videos and much much more.
K'suan'indra also brings us the latest Star Trek Gaming News and myself, Nova and Kinneas are joined this week by Athos who joins our discussions about the latest STO Updates.
Athos also talks to us in detail about the Lotus Fleet Academy in the last 15 minutes of the show.

item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:

In this 30 minute interview, she joins us to talk about many aspects relating to the Community in Star Trek Online, Fleets/Clans/Guilds, the STO Forums, how community will be handled post launch, and much much more.

item.title: Hailing Frequency #58 - STGN, 5 Star Trek Online Updates, SFA, The Trek License and More!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Here is Episode 58 of Hailing Frequency which was broadcast live on Saturday January 10th 2009.
In our first show of 2009 we discuss in detail the multiple updates that have been posted on the Star Trek Online Website since our Christmas show.
We gauge the communities opinions on the topics from the updates which include the ship specs in the new ship of line updates, owning multiple ships and ship physics from the new Ask Cryptic Update and we discuss the new screenshots in detail and analyze how the graphics have improved since the first batch of screenshots and hopefully how they will continue to improve.
We also talk about what might happen to the Star Trek Gaming License once Bethesda's tenure with it expires in 2010/2011 and we check out the Interplay Classic "Starfleet Academy" to see if it still holds up on today's computers.

item.title: Hailing Frequency #57 - Christmas 2008 Special - STGN, Fleet Radio, Majel Roddenberry Dies, A Look Back at 2008, Players Choice 08 Coverage
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Here is the 2008 christmas special of Hailing Frequency which was broadcast and recorded live on December 20th 2008.
In this show, we talk about the hard hitting impact the death of Majel Roddenberry has had on the community. After this, we discuss the latest Star Trek Online Timeline updates and we reveal that we have 2 interviews lined up with Cryptic Studios in January - The first one with Nicole Hamlett aka Awen and the second one which will be with Craig Zinkevich - Dates for both of these will be announced very soon.
Following on for this - we give a little bit of coverage on the 2008 Players Choice Awards from StarTrek-Games.com and discuss some of the nominations to date - voting for this opens on January 1st at http://www.startrek-games.com
We take a look back at the events of 2008 and reveal the full details of how and when exactly Hailing Frequency found out that Cryptic Studios had taken over development of Star Trek Online and we look forward to what we can expect in 2009.
Finally - we remind folks that Hailing Frequency will be going down on December 30th for some major upgrades and refits to upgrade our forum, design and launch some exciting new features for 2009.

item.title: Hailing Frequency #56 - STGN, Star Trek Online, Bethesda and more
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Episode 56 is here after a 7 week break in Hailing Frequency broadcasts. This episode was broadcast live on Saturday 13th December 2008 and released as a podcast on Sunday 14th December.
K'suan brings us a bumper edition of the Star Trek Gaming news this week, bringing us fully up to date on all of the news from the last 7 weeks.
Then we talk about the hot topic - Atari's purchase of Cryptic Studios. Following on from that, we touch briefly on the latest Storyline updates and Ask Cryptic updates.
Later on in the show, we discuss the latest updates from the fan project - Star Trek Excalibur - we speak to Bethesda Softworks to see if they intend to release any more Star Trek Games, and we review the latest Beta Version of Fleet Operations 3 for Armada 2.

item.title: Hailing Frequency Live - July 27th - Cryptic Countdown Show
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
After 36 hours of editing and post production, here we finally have the recorded sound file from our Cryptic Countdown show which was broadcast on Sunday July 27th for around 5 hours.
Key Highlights:
Interview with Rick Sternbach - Senior Illustrator and Technical Advisor on Star Trek since 1979 - We talk to him about a range of things including his thoughts on STO, his thoughts on the NASA Space Program and much much more!
Derek Chester - Co-Writer of Star Trek Legacy, Star Trek Tactical Assault, Star Trek Bridge Commander and the IDW Year 4 comic books, Derek Chester is DC Fontanas writing partner and a huge gamer. He joins us throughout the live show discussing his views on Star Trek Online and much much more.
A huge array of guests throughout the entire show including-
-DIF-Josh who is leader of Consortium Ultimate Gamers -Chris Jones who is head of Chris Jones Gaming -GamerGlo from OnTheAirTV -Pestalance from Dynaverse.net -Lotus Fleet Members Raven, Lrd Nova, Random Redshirt and Admiral of Starfleet -Gemini Fleet -and many many more folks joined us throughout the evening.
We talked about all things Star Trek Online as the Cryptic Countdown edged towards zero and at the end of the evening we provided coverage of the new Cryptic Website and Forums!
We were on the air for well over 5 hours with our main show and we have done our best to edit out any long periods of silence or pauses caused by technical glitches.
For those who only want to listen to the interview we did with Rick Sternbach, I have encoded that section of the show as a standalone file running around 90 minutes.

item.title: Hailing Frequency 52 - STO Confirmed, Derek Chester Interview, Thoughts of a Random Redshirt, Fleet Radio and More
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Here it is - the much waited for next episode of Hailing Frequency - and our longest show this year - Episode 52 of Hailing Frequency.
In this weeks show, the hot topic is of course the mysterious countdown timer that appeared on the Cryptic Website and how it pretty much confirms that Cryptic Studios are developing Star Trek Online.
We cover the facts and take a look at some of the comments folks have been making about the subject.
K'suan'indra brings us a roundup of the Star Trek Gaming News headlines as always, and at the end of the show, she gives us an amazing 35 minute interview with Derek Chester - veteran Star Trek Writer.
We also have two new pilot segments in this show - Thoughts of a Random Redshirt takes a look at other major MMOs on the market today and how elements of them could be applied to or used in Star Trek Online.
Lord Nova brings us an as yet unnamed segment (Called STO-Zone v2 in this show only) which attempts to take over where MrJuliano left of - covering all of the latest news and facts to come out about Star Trek Online. He also takes a look at some of the hot topics of the week on the Hailing Frequency STO Forums.
Thats all until the next show, see you in a couple / few weeks!

item.title: Hailing Frequency 50 ¦ STO-Zone, Mod Weekly, Fleet Radio, STGN and More!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Welcome to our 50th Hailing Frequency Episode. Given the relative quietness in the community as of late, we didnt really have alot to celebrate with, so this is a fairly typical show.
K'suan'indra brings us the latest Star Trek Gaming News roundup as always, and following that we talk about the Current State of the MMO Devlopment world and how risky it is at the moment in MMO Development. With Star Trek Online struggling to be developed, the everchanging devlopment world could see the project shelved!
In Mod Weekly this week, we hear about a Star Trek Mod for the Hit RPG, Neverwinter Nights 2, and we get an update on the DJ Galaxy Class for Bridge Commander.
Kinneas had a chance to play a 2 week free trial on EVE-Online - We hear from a long time trek gamer how EVE shapes up. Does it have good gameplay and what would work in STO?
STO-Zone gets a revamp this week and has a fresh new audio bed. Juliano talks about Ship Models this week! Great Stuff!

item.title: Hailing Frequency 49 ¦ Keys of Legacy Interview, Rockstar, DARPA + STGN and more!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Sorry for the one day delay in the release of this show. A number of coinciding factors caused some technical hitches and delays that unfortunatly could not be avoided. Some of the audio in this show is a little bit off - we are not sure why, however there was some bugs with our recording equipment this week. While its nothing major, i think most of you will notice that this is not up to our usual quality of sound.
However, in terms of quality of content, we have another great show for you. Alexraptor takes 10 minutes to sit down with us and chat about Keys of Legacy, a hit mod for Star Trek Legacy designed to show folks what the game should of been at launch. Also in this weeks show, we talk about the Rockstar takeover of Mad Doc Software and some of the potential options this could open up for trek gaming.
Mr Juliano presents us with the final part of his "Perfect STO" series in STO-zone this week, and following that, Kinneas tells us about how the U.S Department of Defense contacted him to say they are interested in STO!
Unfortunatly, Croesus has had a bit of a family emergency in the past week, so he has had to shoot of to another part of the country to help deal with that, therefore, we do not have a Mod Weekly in this show. It will however be back with an extended edition next show.
Again, we apolagise for the touchy audio in this show, but rest assured the issues will be tracked down and resolved in time for the big 5-0!

item.title: Hailing Frequency 43 ft STO Cancellation, Kingworld, The Alter Ego Show and More!! (Video Version)
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Good Morning, Good Afternoon and Good Evening Trek Gamers,
Please ensure your seats are in their upright and locked position and prepare for a ride - Hailing Frequency 43 is here.
In this episode, we return to normal programming for the first time in 2008 - and you may notice some changes. While the overall feel and format of the show has not changed - we have attempted to further promote the idea and feel that Hailing Frequency is broadcast from a ship - the UFP Devilfish - this is something we have always attempted to convey with varying success. One large step we have taken towards this is the implementation of an "in character" scene at the begining and end of each show lasting no more than a minute each - i think you will find them pleasing!
In an attempt to improve audio quality ever further this year, we have begun using a new method of recording - i think you will all notice the higher clarity and quality!
And now - Kickstarting things this show we have the Star Trek Gaming News from the ever popular and super sexy K'suan'indra.
Following on from the news, we talk about the recently announced bombshell that has affected trek gamers worldwide - Perpetual Entertainment has ceased development on Star Trek Online. We gauge the communitys response too this terrible news and we are later joined by Chris "ChessMess" Koerner of Star Trek Games, Victor "1st" Mullin of Star Trek Gamers, and for the first time ever on Hailing Frequency - the world famous Star Trek Writer Derek Chester.
Mod Weekly returns in this show where we hear about a new mod for Bridge Commander by DJ Kurtis - and on the first fleet radio of 2008 - we here the musical genius Arthur Yoria with "Something Must be Wrong".
Ever heard of KingWorld? Hailing Frequency reveals details of an investigation into the rumours about a new high budget star trek game in 2008 - we left no leaf unturned in our search for information in our attempts to confirm or debunk these rumours.
Lastly - we have STO-Zone episode eleven - with a twist - it seems that we have accidently recieved a transmission from an alternate universe, and the STO Zone has become...."The Alter Ego Show!"

While the overall feel and format of the show has not changed - we have attempted to further promote the idea and feel that Hailing Frequency is broadcast from a ship - the UFP Devilfish - this is something we have always attempted to convey with varying success. One large step we have taken towards this is the implementation of an "in character" scene at the begining and end of each show lasting no more than a minute each - i think you will find them pleasing!

item.title: Hailing Frequency Presents "When the Borg Assimilated Christmas"
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Greetings Trek Gamers and Pod Fans - And a Belated Merry Christmas!
This year, Hailing Frequency wanted to do something truly special for our christmas special - looking back at our christmas shows in 2006 and 2005 - there was'nt really a whole lot about them that was special - so this year, we got together and came up with the idea of doing a fully featured audio and TOONSHOW story - and thus, "When the Borg Assimilated Christmas" was born.
Penned by our very own Dominic Ervolina (aka Mr Juliano) - When the Borg Assimilated Christmas is our first major audio story, set aboard our virtual media ship, the devilfish (Which we would like to have in Star Trek:Online :) ).
The entire Hailing Frequency cast is present - Zach, Kinneas, K'sua'indra, MrJuliano, Croesus, and STO-Zones new co-host, Julianos brother David - (who's voice we had to digitally alter as he sounds so damn similar to juliano)
"When the Borg Assimilated Christmas" is our gift to you all - and we hope you will find it funny and exciting to listen too and watch - and yes, you read right - we said watch.
Kinneas - wanted to do a toonshow version of this special (( He would like ALL our shows to be Toonshows and move away from audio only. Any opinions?)) - as I am sure you can imagine, this was quite an undertaking which is why we are making this release a few days late - Though he is not done with all six scenes (damn, Romulan Ale) ...the show must go on...and so we are releasing the full audio version and the first five toonshows now.
There are some major differences between the two experiences - so we recommend that you check them both out!
(( P.S. Kinneas' 'Fleet Radio Toonshows' on YouTube were chosen as the best Star Trek fan videos on YouTube on the seventh day of 'The Twelve Days of Trek Christmas over at the TrekUnited web site! Check out Kinneas' other toonshows! ))

item.title: Hailing Frequency Episode 41 ft ST Supremacy, STO Zone, Fleet Radio and More!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary: Hey Hey Everybody Its that time again - and we are proud to announce the release of Episode 41 of Hailing Frequency. Normally, we only release two shows per month - one every two weeks, however, Hailing Frequency was invited to take part in Trek Uniteds "Twelve Trek Days of Christmas" project - and here we are. Kicking of the show once again this week, we have K'suan'indra with the Star Trek Gaming News - Sandwiches can be sent to fleetradio@gmail.com. Hot on the heels of the STGN, Zach and Kinneas chat about the recently released ground combat screenshot from Perpetual Entertainments Star Trek Online. Mr Juliano returns this week to bring us another excellent edition of STO ZOne, and immediatly after that, we feature an advert for "st-online.nl" In Fleet Radio this week, Kinneas brings us his Traffic Report concept along with another excellent song choice from a london based band - and following this, i sit down and chat with Mike Strobel, Executive Producer for Star Trek Supremacy, and representative of the BOTFII Project. He updates us on all four projects currently underway over there, and he also clears up some of the misconceptions currently surriounding the development of Birth of the Empires. Finally, Zach and Kinneas discuss the recently released article from Eric Heinburg - A Former systems designer from the STO Dev Team and Zach brings us all another Fan Game review segment. Show Summary: 00.00 - 02.30 - Introduction 02.30 - 13.37 - Star Trek Gaming News from K'sua'indra 13.37 - 13.52 - Advertisements 13.58 - 15.45 - Hailing Frequency / Enterprise Temporal Cold War Competition! Win 4 Amazing Prizes! 15.46 - 20.17 - Zach and Kinneas discuss the STO Ground Combat Screenshot 20.20 - 22.00 - The Twelve Trek Days of Christmas 22.00 - 34.30 - Mr Jullianos STO Zone Episode 10 34.30 - 36.00 - ST-Online.NL Advertisement 36.00 - 37.36 - Zach and Kinneas discuss the STO Promo Video from the TOS Remastered DVD Set 37.36 - 42.53 - Fleet Radio featuring The Northern Electrics with Electric Superhighway 42.53 - 43.43 - Enterprise Temporal Cold War Advertisement 43.43 - 45.15 - Zach and Kinneas Misc 45.15 - 59.15 - Interview with Mike Strobel 59.15 - 1.04.00 - Zach and Kinneas discuss the recent article from Eric Heinburg 1.04.00 - 1.13.52 - Somethings Missing! The Best Free Trek Fan Games 1.13.52 - 1.15.00 - Ending

item.title: Hailing Frequency Episode 40 ft STO, Conquest, Enterprise TCW and More!
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary: Greetings and Salutations Trek Gamers Its been a little while since we the last edition of Hailing Frequency – I am sure allot of you thought we had kicked the bucket – but never fear – Hailing Frequency will always persevere. There has been a lot going on recently, but do not worry as we have been keeping tabs on all of it. During this show, K’sua’indra gets us all caught up on the Star Trek Gaming News for the last couple of months. Following this, we sit down for a chat with Captain Source of the Enterprise Temporal Cold War Project who is able to update us on everything going on over there. We also get to hear samples of TCW’s music which is layered into the background throughout the interview – and some of their voice acting talent! Additionally, we also announce details of a competition in association with Lightspeed Design Studios. We also discuss and review the recently released ‘Star Trek Conquest’ before moving onto a brilliant episode of Mod Weekly from Croesus. After Mod Weekly, we talk in detail about the recently released screenshot from perpetual entertainment – be aware that portions of this discussion may offend the STO-Lovers out there. Finally – Just before we end the show, we run a segment compiled by myself as a response to a cry from community member “RonaldRabbit” – detailing the best free star trek games out there! Show Notes: * Introduction by Hosts Zach and Kinneas * Star Trek Gaming News by K’suan’indra * Interview with Captain Source of Temporal Cold War * Competition Launch! Win Copys of Half Life 2 Episode 1 to play upcoming mod Enterprise: Temporal Cold War * Star Trek Conquest Review by Zach and Kinneas * Mod Weekly 18 from Croesus – Featuring a Review of RPG-X V2.0 * Fleet Radio – Brad Sucks with Bad Attraction. Fleet Radio promotes the idea of radio and media within Star Trek Online. * Star Trek Online Screenshot Discussion by Zach and Kinneas * “Something is Missing” – Free Fan Games Segment by Zach * Hosts Zach and Kinneas say “Goodbye” and End the Show. As always - we appreciate any comments and suggestions that you may like to make about Hailing Frequency. To that end, if you do have any comments to make, please visit our forums at http://www.hailingfrequency.co.uk/boards/

item.itunes:summary: The moment i am sure alot of you have been anticipating and looking forward too has arrived. Hailing Frequency 31 is now released - first of all i would like to apolagise for the delay and explain - we have tried out a new recording and ost prodction tecnique in this show, which involved recording each participant on an individual channel - seperatly editing each of those channels, then syncing them up and merging them to produce the final audio stream - this has all taken a bit of time, however we hope you will notice an increase verbal audio quality. Anyway folks, onto the show. We have taken up a dominantly STO theme in this show (Star Trek Online) with only a little bit of Legacy stuff, so Legacy Lovers please forgive us. item.title: Hailing Frequency Episode #27
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary: Hey Folks, I am happy to announce that after a two day delay, Episode 27 of Hailing Frequency is finally released. The delay was due to our good friend, the Flu Virus, which saw fit to declare war on me, and it turn, caused me to loose my voice for a short period, the battle was lost, however the overall war was won, the germs defeated, and here we are. Episode 27 of Hailing Frequency is yet another milestone and step forward for us, as it sees the most community contributions and segment varietys ever. We start out the show with a thank you to the developers from the entire community, with new music provided by our sound engineer, faxxer. If you wish too add your audio shoutout to this segment, you can record and e-mail your shout in any format to zach@hailingfrequency.co.uk We then go on to the Latest Star Trek Gaming News from Acidrain, who is making a special guest appearance in this episode. Myself and Photon then go on too discuss the recently released Legacy Video showcasing a complete mission from Legacy, and we then listen to the Latest Mod Weekly from Croesus, Hallelujah!. Later on in the show, we hear from Mindwipe, who brings us all the latest Buzz at CUGS, Dr Photon who brings us another hilarious edition of Looney Trek, Kinneas who brings us anothe Fleet Radio, Faxxer who brings us Fleet Gossip, and to top all of that off, we launch a brand new Legacy Competition where you, the community, get a chance to win a brand new copy of the soon to be released Star Trek Legacy, for the PC. As always, we ask you to visit our forums at http://www.hailingfrequency.co.uk/boards/ - register, post, click our ads, etc. Clicks from Our Ads help us pay for our servers to please click once or twice - we would really appreciate it. From the Entire Hailing Frequency Team, we hope you enjoy the show, and we hope too see many of you entering into our newest Legacy Competition. Best Wishes The HF Team

item.title: Hailing Frequency Special - Interview #3 With Rantz Hoseley (Quicksilver Software)
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary: Hey Folks, You get an extra episode of Hailing Frequency this month, as we are releasing this special edition of Hailing Frequency featuring a 45 minite (edited down from 84mins) interview with Rantz Hoseley, Creative Director for Tactical Assault. During the interview we chat about Sales Figures, Alcohol, Modding, the Playstation 3, and the general reaction to Tactical Assault from the gaming world. We also have another interesing episode of Fleet Radio, Featuring Weird Al Yankovic's "Your Pitiful" Hope you all enjoy the show!

item.title: Hailing Frequency Episode #26
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary: Hey Folks That time has come again, hard to believe its been two weeks already since the last Hailing Frequency, but i guess thats just the way of the world, time flys when your having fun, or working a full time job. This week we once again have a jam packed show for you, starting off, kinneas gives us all the latest trek gaming related news, and following on from that, we hear Dr Photons latest Looney Trek. After Looney Trek, We go on to talk for a couple of minites about a new service that Hailing Frequency is offering, Free Community Web Hosting, on either a sub-domain or properly registered domain. For more info on this you can check out our forums. Following on from this, we hear the latest Mod Weekly from Croesus, where he has exclusive access to a brand new DS9 mod for Bridge Commander. Details on this mod are again, on our forums, along with some screenshots. After Mod Weekly, we have the latest Fleet Radio from Kinneas, featuring a guy called Weird Al, who has been around since about 1979 doing parodys of various mainstream songs. This particular one is called "White and Dirty" and is a parody of Chamillionaires "Ridin' Dirty" Going into the last 25mins of the show, we have a long chat with RMoore about the Legacy Stratergy guide, and manage to get loads of new information about Star Trek Legacy - definetly the most information about Legacy to date! Dr Photon joins me and Kinneas for this part of the show. Finally, we annouce the winner of the Star Trek Legacy Signed Poster Competition.

item.title: Hailing Frequency Episode #25
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous, Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Hey Folks,
The moment you have all been waiting for is at hand, the next exciting episode of Hailing Frequency has been released.
I think you are all going to love this weeks show, we start off with the latest edition of the Star Trek Gaming News, where the sexy K'Sua' Nindra, Vulcan Love Slave....Well Ok Just Vulcan, Returns to her usual position hosting the news, We then go into latest Hilarious Edition of Looney Trek from Dr Photon, which recieved high praise last show.
This is followed by a 5 minite chat about Star Trek in Second Life from myself, and we then go into the latest Mod Weekly from the man that everyone loves, Croesus!
Following that, we chat to RMoore about the difficulties of moderating a forum such as this, and about his experiences with Star Trek Tactical Assault, which we go on to briefly review. Croesus join Zach and Kinneas for this interview.
Fleet Radio comes up next, featuring Warp 11's award winning song, Red Alert (Explicit Language Warning in Effect for this Segment)
After fleet radio we reveal the Poster Competition results, and go on to launch another Competition.
Bringing up the rear of the show, we have a special 8min segment for you, however we are keeping this classified top secret, you will have to listen to find out what it is, i think you will all be suitable pleased with it though. Remember, Imitation is the Highest Form of Flattery.
Show Notes:
Hosted by Zach and Kinneas! Star Trek Gaming News from K'sua'nindra Looney Trek from Doctor Photon Star Trek in Second Life Mod Weekly from Croesus Interview with RMoore Fleet Radio ft Warp 11 with Red Alert (www.warp11.com - show your support!) Competition Results New Competition Secret Segment!
Technical Info:
M-Peg Layer 3 at 96kbps Stereo Filesize: 47.7mb

item.title: Hailing Frequency Episode #24
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous and Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Starting the show off, Dr Photon brings us a new showly segment that will have even the most stern and most emotionally controlled people, laughing their asses off.
After this, Kinneas and Croesus speak about Star Trek Encounters, and give us a brief rundown and review of the game.
We later feature a 40 minite interview with CaptainSource, Lead Producer of the Enterprise Temporal Cold War Project, and to top of the show, we launch a competition in association with Bethesda, where you have a chance to win some signed Legacy Posters!
Its a long show this week, clocking in at almost 1 hour and 30 minites
Shows Notes:
Hosted by Zach and Kinneas Dr Photons "Looney Trek" (working name) Mod Weekly Episode 2 - Croesus talks Bridge Commander Max Loefs Bridge Commander Mod Fleet Radio - I Love Star Trek by Micheal Roth Interview with CaptainSource of Enterprise: TCW Legacy Competition! And Much Much More!

item.title: Hailing Frequency Episode #16
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous and Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Here it is folks, finally, Episode 16 of Hailing Frequency is out!
Apolagies for the long delay (6weeks) since the last show, ive been busy moving homes so everything has been a bit hectic.
Show Notes:
* Hosted by Zach and Kinneas * Star Trek Gaming News [05:00] * Hailing Frequency Competition Results [07:12] * The Victor1st Zone [09:25] * Fleet Gossip Episode 5 from Faxxer of STOnet [27:45] * Fleet Radio - Lemondemon - Telekinesis [29:45] * Interview with DIf-Josh, Founder of Consortium Ultimate Gamers [35:20] * New Competition [42:40] * Mod Weekly - Armada 2, 2.5 mod [45:15] * Closing Music [50:20]
Another excellent show if i do say so myself, i know its been a long time since the last one, but i think everyone will agree this has been worth the wait.
Fleet Gossip is just SOOO Hilarious this week, even though its so short.
The Interview with Josh from CUGs is short but very sweet, and Mod Weekly is also cool this week.
by far my favorite this week though, Fleet Radio - that song is just so damn good, catchy too, i cant stop listening to it!!!

item.title: Hailing Frequency Episode #12
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous and Tony Tuthill and Victor Mullin
item.itunes:summary:
Show Notes:
* Hosted by Zach and Kinneas * Special Guest Host - Victor 1st of Star Trek Gamers * Opening Music - Robert Picardo a.k.a The Doctor - La Donne Imobbile * Opening Commentary from Zach, Kinneas and Victor * The Victor1st Zone * Fleet Radio - Arthur Yoria - Strange Grin * Commentary from Zach, Kinneas and Victor - Discussing Legacy, and Tactical Alert * Advertisement Break * Commentary from Zach and Kinneas and Victor - A Goodbye to Harry Lang! * Fleet Gossip - A New Segment from STO-net's Faxxer * Closing Commentary from Zach, Kinneas and Victor
Almost a Month since the last show - but hey, you know what they say, Quality is Better than quantity....Right?
Well Quality is definetly one word to descirbe the show this week.
With the announement of the new trek games, we decided to bring in Victor this week to do the show with us - and i have to say - it was a laugh - Contrary to what everyone thinks - and although Victor probably wont admit it - He's a very nice guy at heart!
After several hours, multiple bloopers, and some laughs on the top, this show was the result!
To top it off, we have a new segment this week from Faxxer of STO.net - and, although i personally had no clue what he was talking about, I found his on-air attitude and demeanor very refreshing - he is the type of guy who, even if you have no clue what on earth he is talking about - you can still follow him, and laugh with him!
Additionally, this show, Kinneas has worked hard, and has once again produced a wonderful video accompniment for this show - definetly worth checking out folks!
Hope everyone enjoys it - And remember - this is a community podcast - So do not hesitate to Send in audio clips and submissions to zach@hailingfrequency.co.uk

item.title: Hailing Frequency Episode #10
item.itunes:author: Zach Nicodemous and Tony Tuthill
item.itunes:summary:
Some of you may be wondering why i pulled the MP3 version of Hailing Frequency earlier this week.
The answer is, our main man Kinnea's has been working his butt of for the last two weeks to produce a VIDEO PODCAST of Hailing Frequency 10!!
So as not to limit our audience, we are releasing several versions of the show to accomadate all people.
There shall be the standard standalone audio show, an apple quicktime version which is optimised for video ipods and viewable in quicktime or itunes, and later on, there will be a .avi.
Low and Behold, it is HERE!
Show Notes:
* Hosted by ChessMess and Zach!!!! * Opening Welcome and Opening Music! * Opening Commentary from Zach and Chess * Fleet Radio * Commentary from Zach and Chess * Segment From Victor1st from Star Trek Gamers * Commentary from Chess and Zach and Holly (chessmess's baby) * Star Trek Gaming News by Kayswanindra * Closing Commentary from Chess and Zach * Outro Song - Star Trekking (oh no!!) * Video by Kinneas
Its a long one this week, clocking in at 71 minutes, and it is also 50 megabytes - sorry dialup users!!!
Sorry about not having any new shows for almost a month, but we have more than made up for it this one! This show has it all, including many laughable moments!!
